results.title: The Sooper Puppy series. - Volume 1
results.brief_description: Contains two episodes aimed at helping young children deal with moral questions and emotions : ‘A Friend in need’ Sooper Puppy stands his ground to prevent one friend from getting involved in selling drugs, and another from playing with a gun. ‘This, that or the other’ sees Sooper Puppy exploring the complications in recognising the difference between right and wrong. He faces a series of decisions concerning friends, family and responsibility. Suitabel for Kindergarten and Lower Primary level students.

results.title: The Song remains the same [Led Zeppelin: in concert and beyond] (S)
results.brief_description: This is a compilation of the best of Led Zeppelin’s concert appearances throughout 1973 at Madison Square Garden. It includes 13 of the band’s most incredible, and influential songs, such as “Stairway to heaven”, “Dazed and confused” and “Whole lotta love”. Interspersed with the concert footage are candid moments with band members Robert Plant, Jimmy Page, John Paul Jones and John Bonham. As is the case with the trend setting foursome, there is also a healthy dose of fantasy sequences.

results.title: The Song of Bernadette
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, William Perlberg and Henry King
results.brief_description: A superb cast, including Vincent Price and Jennifer Jones triumph in this Academy Award winning film that tells the story of Bernadette Soubirous, the poverty-stricken, pure-hearted adolescent who saw a vision of a “Beautiful Lady” near her home town of Lourdes in 1858. The wondrous news spreads rapidly throughout France, leaving in its wake a variety of consequences. This true story, told with profound sincerity, sensitivity and reverence is both first rate filmmaking and an inspiring tribute to faith, personal courage and the glory of the human spirit.

results.title: The Son of the Sheik. - [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Gregstan Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
Presents an edited version of the 1926 production of “The Son of the Sheik”, a typical adventure of the golden age of the movies. Stars Rudolph Valentino. Narrated by Paul Killiam.

results.title: The Son of the sheik
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, J Schneck and George Fitzmaurice
results.brief_description: Valentino in his greatest role as the notorious shiek, the defiant and romantic heroic figure of the Arabian desert. This is the classic tale of the English-born but desert-bred Shiek, who fired by the love of a French dancing girl, risks all in his quest to possess her. The torrid sequence of the shiek and his Yasmine, now kidnapped and isolated in his tent, remains a landmark portrayal of sensual desire. A special bonus at the end includes highlights from Valentino’s career and the mass hysteria captured on film when Valentino died.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United Artists Corporation, J Schneck and George Fitzmaurice

results.title: The Son of God crucified
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: Pilate allows the crowds to choose between Jesus and Barrabas, the crowd chooses Barrabas; Jesus leaves the Praetorium carrying the cross; He is led through the streets of Jerusalem; Jesus sees Nicodemus and is met by the pious woman; on Calvary Jesus is nailed and hung on a cross between two thieves; The Centurion allows Mary and the women to stand at the foot of the cross; Jesus talks to his mother and John; Jesus dies on the cross and is taken down.

results.title: The Son = Le Fils [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Fleuve, Archipel 35, Radio Television Belge Francophone (RTBF), Jean-Pierre Dardenne, Luc Dardenne and Denis Freyd
results.brief_description: Internationally acclaimed filmmakers Belgian brothers Jean-Pierre and Luc Dardenne (Rosetta, 1999) once again present a powerful story built around its central characters in a stylised and moving drama of moral reckoning. Featuring Olivier Gourmet in the role of Olivier, a somewhat dour carpenter who teaches his craft to help rehabilitate troubled teenagers and Morgan Marinne as Francis, the new student who becomes an object of inexplicable obsession by his teacher, Olivier. This ambiguously slow-moving story is stark and intensely gripping as it moves towards its unexpected ending. Cast also includes Isabella Soupart with verite-style cinematography by Alain Marcoen. (Awards: Olivier Gourmet, Best Actor 2002 Cannes Film Festival; Prize of the Ecumenical Jury - Special Mention 2002 Cannes Film Festival)

results.title: The Son's room = La Stanza Del Figlio
results.creator_credit: Bac Films (France), Canal+, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Sacher Film, Telepiu, Angelo Barbagallo and Nanni Moretti
results.brief_description: This melancholic and intimate Italian drama tackles the subject of death of a child and the catastrophic after effects on family. Giovanni is a successful psychoanalyst residing in a quaint seaside town. He has a warm and tender relationship with his wife, and two adolescent children - son, Andrea and daughter, Irene. This family is loving and understanding, interested in one another and well adjusted. Focussing on Giovanni, he is depicted as affectionate and caring even as he worries about Andrea’s attitude and troubles at school. This idyllic calm is shattered when Andrea accidentally drowns and the remainder of the film examines how each individual family member adjusts to Andrea’s death, deals with their loss and how the family struggles on as a unit. Internalising his sorrow and guilt, Giovanni plays out endless streams of ‘what-ifs’, whilst his isolation corrodes his relationships with wife and daughter. Part of the appeal of Moretti’s film is his observation of the ordinariness of grief and the moments where it strikes, achieving true pathos and catharsis. Written, directed and starring Moretti, “The Son’s room” is a poignant and compassionate work that is effective and understated as it gently examines the difficulties inherent within mourning and death. Cast includes Nanni Moretti, Laura Morante, Silvio Orlando and Stefano Accorsi.

results.title: The Son
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Michael Spencer and Julian Biggs
results.brief_description: A dramatic portrayal of a not infrequent rural problem: the tendency of farmers’ sons to leave the land in favour of other employment. The serene pastoral countryside of southern Ontario provides the story background. Howard, an only son, has grown to manhood under his father’s domination, working for a weekly pittance that offers no independence. His resentment finally threatens a complete break from the farm. A legal partnership agreement between father and son provides an amicable solution. (Award: Toronto.)

results.title: The Solar system. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Thomas Smith
results.brief_description: Investigates the structure and composition of the solar system, describes the origin of the Sun and its planets and surveys the major planetary bodies in the solar system. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
